Losing Armor
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Losing Armor
By Nate Railsback on Thursday, June 19, 2003 - 09:46 pm:

Hey, now that I'm going back to this game, I've got an odd question related to one I asked a year and a half ago about Tough Skin. Is there any way to lose the Characteristic "Armor"? I raised a Speed-oriented Durahan/Brillia, and have since then passed on its powers another Speed-based creature (Momo/Brillia) who unfortunately inherited the ability, despite having a fluffy-cute body! Does anyone know of any monsters that absolutely cannot have the Armor trait passed on to them? Or will I have to raise a Hare next to just plain have its Fancy Footwork trait counterbalance?

By torey luvullo on Friday, June 20, 2003 - 03:42 am:

there is a decent rant on the subject at gamefaqs mr3 board. the author of the rant is a durahan trainer, and has taken his durahan heart through all sorts of monsters, and has yet been unable to get rid of armor. I never used a durahan to start a heartline, so i was unaware of how dogged this char is.

what you might want to do is put the heart into a baby, and dmm the kid for as long as it takes to find 8 new chars, which might crowd out the armor. however, this is a laborious solution - anyone else have any thoughts?

By Deadbuffalo on Friday, June 20, 2003 - 08:23 am:

Armor is a characteristic that EVERY monster can get. The other defensive characteristics, such as tough skin, thick fur, hard scales, etc, are exclusive to certain breeds, making them easy to get rid of during the passing of the heart(just give it to a breed that can't recieve the characteristic). Armor is nearly impossible to get rid of as torey and durahan trainer suggested.
Finding 8 new chars might work, but I'm not exactly sure on the mechanics of that procedure. Here is the best solution for getting rid of armor. Start a new heartline, and make sure you don't raise any durahans with it.
